contentrichtext.text: {{Other uses|Third Age (disambiguation)}} {{In-universe|date=January 2010}} {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{History of Arda}} The '''Third Age''' is a time period from [[J. R. R. Tolkien]]'s [[Middle-earth]] fantasy writings. The history of Middle-earth is to be taken fictionally as a history of the real Earth. The Third Age began after the first downfall of [[Sauron]], when he was defeated by the [[Last Alliance of Elves and Men]] following the downfall of [[Númenor]]. This age was characterized by the waning of the [[Elf (Middle-earth)|Elves]]. In the beginning of the Third Age, many Elves left for [[Valinor]] because they were disturbed by the recent war. However, Elven kingdoms still survived in [[Lindon (Middle-earth)|Lindon]], [[Lothlórien]], and [[Mirkwood]]. [[Rivendell]] also became a prominent haven for the Elves and other races. Throughout the Age, they chose not to mingle much in the matters of other lands, and only came to the aid of other races in time of war. The Elves chose to devote themselves to artistic pleasures, and tended to the lands which they occupied. The gradual decline of Elven populations occurred throughout the Age as the rise of Sauron came to dominate [[Middle-earth]]. By the end of the Third Age, only mere fragments of the once-grand Elven civilization survived in Middle-earth. The Third Age was also characterized by the rise and decline of the Númenórean kingdoms of Arnor and [[Gondor]]. Meant to be one kingdom, the two countries split in the beginning of the Third Age, each experiencing different fates. The so-called Watchful Peace began in 2063 T.A., when [[Gandalf]] went to [[Dol Guldur]] and the evil dwelling there (later known to be [[Sauron]]) fled east. It lasted until 2460 T.A., when Sauron returned with new strength. During the [[Watchful Peace]] Gondor strengthened its borders, keeping a watchful eye on the east, as [[Minas Morgul]] was still a threat on their flank and [[Mordor]] was still occupied with [[Orc (Middle-earth)|Orc]]s. But no major escalations occurred except for minor skirmishes with [[Umbar]]. In the north, [[Arnor]] was long gone, but the [[Hobbit]]s of the [[Shire (Middle-earth)|Shire]] prospered, getting their first [[Took clan|Took]] [[Thains of the Shire|Thain]], and colonizing [[Buckland (Middle-earth)|Buckland]]. The [[Dwarf (Middle-earth)|Dwarves]] of [[Durin's folk]] under [[Thorin I]] abandoned [[Erebor]], and left for the [[Ered Mithrin|Grey Mountains]], where most of their kin now gathered. Meanwhile Sauron was not idle in the east: he created a strong alliance between the various tribes of [[Easterlings]], so that when he returned he was more powerful and had many [[Man (Middle-earth)|Men]] in his service. The Third Age lasted for 3021 years, until Sauron was defeated for good when his [[One Ring|Ruling Ring]] was destroyed. When [[Elrond]], [[Bilbo Baggins|Bilbo]] and [[Frodo Baggins]], [[Gandalf]] and [[Galadriel]] left Middle-earth for the [[Valinor|Uttermost West]], the [[Fourth Age]] began. ==See also== {{Portal|Middle-earth}} *[[Timeline of Arda#Third Age|Timeline of the Third Age]] *[[Of the Rings of Power and the Third Age]] {{Middle-earth}} [[Category:Middle-earth eras]] [[fr:Chronologie de la Terre du Milieu#Le Troisième Âge]]
